result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik L. Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Computer Message-Threaten/Injury or Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol.
Maintain employment and/or continue with education.

DOC Collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik L. Stewart

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 9:43 AM Defendant Malik L. Stewart in court, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Kelly J. Freeman in court for Malik L. Stewart.  Attorney Anne Theresa Nack in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation, concurrent with 20CF404 and 20CF582, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, maintain employment and/or continue with education, DOC collect costs, 133 days sentence credit.
Calendar call on October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:20 AM Defendant Malik L. Stewart in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter Isaacson by video. David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $250.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victims C.K.P. or L.N.P., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Court orders Level 3 supervision through JusticePoint. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
